title: XPathOperators

metadata.description: Learn about XPathOperators with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
An XPath expression returns either a node-set, a string, a 
Boolean, or a number.
XPath Operators
Below is a list of the operators that can be used in XPath expressions:
Operator
Description
Example
|
Computes two node-sets
//book | //cd
+
Addition
6 + 4
-
Subtraction
6 - 4
*
Multiplication
6 * 4
div
Division
8 div 4
=
Equal
price=9.80
!=
Not equal
price!=9.80
<
Less than
price<9.80
<=
Less than or equal to
price<=9.80
>
Greater than
price>9.80
>=
Greater than or equal to
price>=9.80
or
or
price=9.80 or price=9.70
and
and
price>9.00 and price<9.90
mod
Modulus (division remainder)
5 mod 2

★
+1

practice_exercises.title: Practice Exercise
practice_exercises.description: Create an example that applies the concepts from this tutorial.

quiz.question: Which best describes the main purpose of this c feature?
quiz.explanation: This feature serves multiple purposes in software development.

summary: This tutorial covers XPathOperators concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use XPathOperators effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of XPathOperators and how to apply it in your projects.
